page.title: 04RELIGION in Withington
page.content: The{Anglican Church}of St. Peter is a small corrugated iron building, part of the Chelford Ecclesiastical Diocese. Services are held each Sunday evening at 6.30pm. with a congregation of approximatly 20 mainly the older population. Young families travel to Chelford. The church is not licenced for marriages. Funerals do take place, but the burial ground is at the Methodist Chapel. A seperate register of baptisms is kept at the Mother Church. The{Methodist Chapel}is under Congleton Circuit, and pays it's dues to Congleton. The church and chapel combine their services on certain days of the year; these being Plough Sunday, Rogation Day, Harvest, and for Christmas Carols. Followers of the {Roman Catholic}faith travel 4 klmtrs to Holmes Chapel, or to Macclesfield.
